content.description: The Welcome boulder has lots of good traversing on its northern side.  Go either right to left or left to right.  Stay high, stay low or use anything you can find.  Any way you approach it, it's a fun warm-up for the harder stuff nearby.
content.location:
Where the Overcliff, Undercliff and Trapps roads meet on the north side of the Trapps Bridge.                

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.

content.description: Stand start on the nice slot on the right side of Behemoth boulder. Follow the diagonal crack up and left until you can pull into the New Pair of Glasses alcove. Top out easily to the left.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter, landing is flat but you probably don't want to fall pulling the roof into the alcove
content.location: Look for the obvious diagonal crack on the right side of Behemoth boulder, starting right where it meets Satellite 2

content.description:
Across the Undercliff Road from the Behemoth boulder is the Stained boulder, so called because of its red and green hues.   

  Start on thin sideways holds on the face.  Continue up the face to the top out without using the arete for hands. 

  From Colin Best: A sit start for this problem makes the three-move maneuver v3. With the right toe on the usual start, a right hand on the sloped arete four inches above, and a left hand mantled on the the usual left foot start, back flag the left foot real hard and lock. Reach up for the lowest razor crimp on the moon shaped crack and bring the flagged left foot into the the left foot start hold with a drop knee. Bump left hand into the usual start crimp and work your way to the top. The back flag, lock, and crimp work only adds up to a few moves, but they are techy and fun.
content.location:
Across the road from the Behemoth boulder.                

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.

content.description: Start on the two heavily chalked holds on the right edge of the boulder. Top out is high but secure.
content.protection: At least two pads. After sending, be very careful with the downclimb. It is very easy to slide and fall off, resulting in potentially fatal injuries.
content.location: Large(est) overhanging boulder on the south-east side of the carriage road.

content.description: Sit start with right hand on the good side pull, a foot or so to the left of the tree. Left on hand on good pebbly ledge. Get your feet up and crank to a slopey pebble ledge. Continue along the rail, then fire for the pinch. Topout the same as Pollock.
content.location: Overhanging boulder uphill from the welcome boulder.

content.description: Start low just on top of small, but dangerous rock and move up left to the jug.  Then move right and merge into New Pair of Glasses after the crux. Top out very high after a few more big moves with good holds.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter are recommended.

content.description: Yes, I know Greene and Russo give it V4.  It's certainly fun but not V4.  Clamber down to a sitting position between the trees on either side of the problem under the overhanging back side of the Satellite #2 boulder.  Start with your arms buried in the face-level crack to your left and a few good foot jams to your right now climb, crimp and jam your way up to the top out.
content.location:
Between two trees growing behind the Satellite #2 boulder not far from where it abuts the Behemoth boulder.                

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.

content.description: Greene and Russo give it V2, but it's certainly no harder than V1 and more likely V0.  Start sitting just to the right of one of the two trees that mark the start of The Lorax.  Get your feet in the horizontal and pull jugs to the top out on a crack system a short distance above.
content.location:
To the right of the rightmost of two trees growing behind the Satellite #2 boulder just to the left of where it abuts the Behemoth boulder.                

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.

content.description: This route is very easy and a good warm-up climb to start the day.
content.location: From the Steel Bridge, walk down the undercliff road until you get to the behemoth boulder. The behemoth boulder is the one that is the most overhanging that you can see from the Steel Bridge. From the behemoth boulder walk to the right and climb the farthest left you can on the Satellite #2 boulder.

content.description: Start on the left side of the overhanging dihedral. Left hand on the edge/crack and right hand on the pinch, launch over and continue through New Pair.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. Don't fall from the top.
content.location: Start is the same area as New Pair.

content.description: You can see this overhanging boulder from the carriage road. It has a tree growing out of the right side of it. Sit start with both hands on a pebbly horizontal edge on the left side of the boulder. Sit start almost lying down. Climb straight up the overhanging face. Top out on slab. Detached boulder on the left side is off for the feet at the very start.
content.location: Overhanging boulder directly uphill from the welcome boulder.

content.description: Start on pebbly holds to the right of Carriage Way Crack. Go up on good crimps toward a crack that begins near the top and top out in this crack.
content.protection: Pad. Watch your head at the top as you near the boulder on the right.
content.location: To the right of Carriage Way Crack.

content.description: Start with two underclings on the short overhanging face.  Pull a single move, using trickery, to the jug at the lip, and top out.This was a longstanding project that revolved around a single very difficult pull off the ground on poor underclings.  While laying on the pads in a moment of frustration at the seeming impossibility of getting off the ground, the FAist was inspired to try some modern comp-style beta, and was surprised to find that it worked.
content.location: On the highway side of the welcome boulder.  A short overhang just off the carriage road, hikers right if walking down towards the main Trapps cliffline.

content.description: Climb the very wide crack and top out
content.protection: Pads and spotters, but poor landing
content.location: The obvious wide crack, left of the Million Dollar Problem

content.description: Sit start on a low rail, then climb up and right through more bad rails. Reach a high right sidepull, then grab the lip and top out
content.location: On the Behemoth boulder in the cave right next to Satellite boulder #2; across from the lorax.

content.description: From the horizontal crack climb the face and arete to the top out.  There's a good move or two toward the top.
content.location:
From the Trapps Bridge, walk toward the               

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.       just right of the carriage road and just before the Welcome boulder.  Step down off of the road to find the start of the problem.                

The Satellite #2 Boulder in the Steel Bridge Area: 1. Carriage Way Face (V0), 2. Carriage Way Crack (V0-)

content.description: This is a great route for beginning boulderers.  The problem is probably 5.5 or 5.6 so well within anyone's ability.  From the low horizontal, climb the crack and top out.
content.location:
From the Trapps Bridge, walk toward the               

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.       just right of the carriage road and just before the Welcome boulder.  Step down off of the road to find the start of the problem.                

The Satellite #2 Boulder in the Steel Bridge Area: 1. Carriage Way Face (V0), 2. Carriage Way Crack (V0-)

content.description: There are a few nice moves on this.  Put your hands on a good hold on the left arete, get your feet off of the deck and climb the arete to the top out.
content.location:
On the left arete of the               

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.      .               

The Satellite #5 Boulder in the Steel Bridge Area: 1. Bronco (V0), 2. Cookies and Cream (V9)

content.description: There's no specific route up the Boulder of the Gods, but that doesn't mean that there isn't a lot of climbing to be had here on the boulder's big sloping face.  Climb to the top without using the sides.  Now try out the many possible variations by starting further left or right.  How about laying back the boulder's edge?  Can you get up without using any hands on the face.  You'll either be warmed up or tired out by the time you're done here.
content.location:
Near the start of the Overcliff Road, behind the Welcome Boulder.                

Looking north from the Kiosk near the Steel Bridge.

content.description:
Twenty or so routes dot the boulders a stones that are throw away from the Trapps bridge.  While it is home to the Behemoth boulder and its highball test pieces like               

Tyler on A New Pair of Glasses (V7)      ,               

Tyler on Million Dollar Problem (V5)       and Colorful Crack (V1), there are also quite a few good warm-up problems.  There are many ways to get to the top of the Boulder of the Gods (V0-), and innumerable approaches to traversing the Welcome Boulder (V0).  The Stained Boulder (V1) problem and Lazy Mazie (V1-) also make for a good moderate start to the day.  Don't miss the steep jug hauling and jamming on the Lorax (V2).
